channel.title: Why is Black Mesa a "non-steam mod"?
channel.description:
Im wondering that Black Mesa is a non-steam game. In steam Library ist declared as a "non-steam mod".
As far as i understand that means that it wont show my achiements, nor got any updates/patches via steam?
Why is that so? Isnt there some kind of cooperation since its using the source engine and stuff?

item.title: Why is Black Mesa a "non-steam mod"?
item.dc:creator: JezMM
item.description:
Only games officially put onto Steam for purchase/download by Valve will support out-of-game achievement displays and automatic updates etc. All Steam does is offer a convenienent, organised way to launch and play mods.

It’s not very different to when you add a non-Steam game you bought on a disc or downloaded from elsewhere to your library, just to have a shortcut and overlay functionality.
